comments.html: Great Post. But does MTU limitations factor into consideration? Our SP was previously looking to provide a layer 2 service across the internet and found that cisco in the last year has put some work into beefing up their MPLS over DMVPN solution on IOS-XE. While VXLAN makes more sense in DCs and even on campus networks what about larger networks? If my math is right using a MPLS over DMVPN with IPSEC enabled solution has less overhead than using VXLAN over DMVPN/IPSEC?
comments.name: Alex

comments.html:
I honestly don't want to know anything about a layer-2 service across the Internet. Just the thought makes me shudder...

As for MPLS- or VXLAN-over-DMVPN, I don't think I've seen anyone using VXLAN yet, but I'm sure that's about to change. From the overhead perspective MPLS definitely makes more sense.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak
